trans-unit.source: Initializes a new instance of the exception class.
trans-unit.target: Initializes a new instance of the exception class.

trans-unit.source: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with serialized data.
trans-unit.target: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with serialized data.

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference>System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo</codeEntityReference> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference>System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo</codeEntityReference> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference>System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext</codeEntityReference> that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference>System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext</codeEntityReference> that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

trans-unit.source: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code.
trans-unit.target: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code.

trans-unit.source: The error code returned by the service or generated by client.
trans-unit.target: The error code returned by the service or generated by client.

trans-unit.source: This error code can be used for writing exception handling logic.
trans-unit.target: This error code can be used for writing exception handling logic.

trans-unit.source: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
trans-unit.target: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

trans-unit.source: The error code returned by the service or generated by client.
trans-unit.target: The error code returned by the service or generated by client.

trans-unit.source: This error code can be used for writing exception handling logic.
trans-unit.target: This error code can be used for writing exception handling logic.

trans-unit.source: The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a <embeddedLabel>null</embeddedLabel> reference if no inner exception is specified.
trans-unit.target: The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a <embeddedLabel>null</embeddedLabel> reference if no inner exception is specified.

trans-unit.source: It may especially contain the actual error message returned by the service.
trans-unit.target: It may especially contain the actual error message returned by the service.

trans-unit.source: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code and error message.
trans-unit.target: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code and error message.

trans-unit.source: The error code returned by the service or generated by client.
trans-unit.target: The error code returned by the service or generated by client.

trans-unit.source: This error code can be used for writing exception handling logic.
trans-unit.target: This error code can be used for writing exception handling logic.

trans-unit.source: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
trans-unit.target: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

trans-unit.source: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code, error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
trans-unit.target: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code, error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

trans-unit.source: The error code returned by the service or generated by client.
trans-unit.target: The error code returned by the service or generated by client.

trans-unit.source: This error code can be used for writing exception handling logic.
trans-unit.target: This error code can be used for writing exception handling logic.

trans-unit.source: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
trans-unit.target: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

trans-unit.source: The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference if no inner exception is specified.
trans-unit.target: The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference if no inner exception is specified.

trans-unit.source: It may especially contain the actual error message returned by the service.
trans-unit.target: It may especially contain the actual error message returned by the service.
